intro: Auriculardisia boltenii, commonly known as the Bolten's earviolet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive violet-colored flowers with auriculate (ear-shaped) petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
